text: Steven Mackay (born 26 June 1981) is a Scottish footballer who is player- manager of Highland Football League club Brora Rangers. Mackay began his career with Ross County, for whom he made 80 appearances over seven seasons in the Scottish League, which included five seasons in the First Division. He also played in the lower divisions of the league for Elgin City and Peterhead, and for Highland League clubs Forres Mechanics and Nairn County. He signed for Brora Rangers in 2012, and won the Highland League title with them in the 2013–14 season. In the play offs the following year Brora won the chance for promotion to the Scottish Football League for the first time in their history, but with Brora ahead Mackay was sent off and they lost.BBC News report on the game Steven Mackay is the current player-manager at Brora Rangers. https://brorarangers.football/managerial-team/ ==References== Category:1981 births Category:Living people Category:People from Ross and Cromarty Category:Scottish footballers Category:Association football forwards Category:Ross County F.C. players Category:Elgin City F.C. players Category:Forres Mechanics F.C. players Category:Peterhead F.C. players Category:Nairn County F.C. players Category:Brora Rangers F.C. players Category:Scottish Football League players Category:Scottish football managers Category:Brora Rangers F.C. managers
title: Steven Mackay
